channel.title: Setup | AppsCode Service Broker on GitHub for Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in Setup | AppsCode Service Broker on GitHub for Kubernetes

item.title: Install | AppsCode Service Broker
item.description: Installation Guide Prerequisites First you need to have the software services by AppsCode installed in the cluster. Currently AppsCode Service Broker supports the following software service: KubeDB So we need to have KubeDB installed to go forward. To install KubeDB see here. To check the installation for AppsCode Service Broker, we have used Service Catalog. So, this document assumes that you’ve installed Service Catalog onto your cluster. If you haven’t, please see the installation instructions.

item.title: Table of Contents | Setup
item.description: Setup Setup contains instructions for installing the AppsCode Service Broker and its various components in Kubernetes. Install AppsCode Service Broker. Installation instructions for AppsCode Service Broker. Uninstall AppsCode Service Broker. Instructions for uninstallating AppsCode Service Broker. Developer Guide Overview. Outlines everything you need to know from setting up your dev environment to how to build and test AppsCode Service Broker. Release process. Steps for releasing a new version of AppsCode Service Broker.

item.title: Uninstall | AppsCode Service Broker
item.description: Uninstall Service Broker To uninstall service-broker, run the following command: $ helm del <release_name> --purge To uninstall AppsCode cloud services, follow the links below: Uninstall KubeDB
